history.content: It just means that you can only use 2 upper-division courses when fulfilling degree requirements for both majors. For example, taking DS100 and CS189 would give you credit towards both majors but all other courses taken would only satisfy requirements towards 1 of the 2.

Does this just mean that a maximum of 2 classes can count towards both majors' requirements? Yes

Would these classes be written in both major 1 and major 2 columns for upper division courses? Yes

Can I still take other classes that could potentially fulfill both requirements (say, CS170, which fulfills the CS UD requirement and the DS Computational and Inferential Depth requirement), but would in reality just fulfill one major requirement? Yes

I'm trying to double in CS and Data Science. The double major declaration form states that I can't have any more than 2 upper-division courses overlapping between the two majors. Can someone elaborate on this?

Does this just mean that a maximum of 2 classes can count towards both majors' requirements? Would these classes be written in both major 1 and major 2 columns for upper division courses? Can I still take other classes that could potentially fulfill both requirements (say, CS170, which fulfills the CS UD requirement and the DS Computational and Inferential Depth requirement), but would in reality just fulfill one major requirement?
history.subject: Double Major- Overlapping UD Courses

history.content: I'm trying to double in CS and Data Science. The double major declaration form states that I can't have any more than 2 upper-division courses overlapping between the two majors. Does this prevent me from taking more than 2 courses that fulfill UD requirements for both majors? Or is it just that only 2 of them will count towards both majors' requirements?
history.subject: Double Major- Overlapping UD Courses
